q: Reflecting on the Arizona shootings that killed six people and badly wounded Rep. Gabrielle Giffords , Colin Powell said he was dismayed by the harsh tenor of political debate that some have said may have contributed to the attack. There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do, he said. "All sorts of nastiness. And it is not just politicians who are doing this to each other, and, frankly, politics has always been a contact sport in this country. but with

-- Dick Cheney Dick Cheney said Friday he has called a "truce" with old colleagues over the Iraq war and is going hunting again. Colin Powell who criticized his policies as vice president, Dick Cheney replied, I prefer to think of it as a truce, Brian. "Clearly we had differences on subsequent policy issues," he said. Regarding Ben Roethlisberger , Roger Goodell said when he was investigating what to do with the quarterback, he talked to I bet two dozen[ Steeler] players... Not one, not a single player, went to his defense. It wasn't personal in a sense, but all kinds of stories like, "He won't sign my jersey.' He says he thinks Mike Michael Vick "is sincerely trying."
